00001 /* Based on functions in linux/string.h */

00003 #include <linux/types.h>        /* for size_t */
00004 
00005 #if defined(__alpha__) || defined (NO_ASSEMBLY)
00006 
00007 #define __memcpy(dst,src,n)                     memcpy((dst),(src),(n))
00008 #define __memcpy_conventional(dst,src,n)        memcpy((dst),(src),(n))
00009 #define __memcpyb(dst,src,n)                    memcpy((dst),(src),(n))
00010 #define __memsetb(dst,c,n)                      memset((dst),(c),(n))
00011 #define __memsetlong(dst,c,n)                   memset((dst),(c),(n))
00012 #define __memset(dst,c,n)                       memset((dst),(c),(n))
00013 #define __memset2(dst,c,n)                      memset((dst),(c),2*(n))
00014 #define __memset3(dst,c,n)                      memset((dst),(c),3*(n))
00015 
00016 #else
00017 
00018 static inline void *
00019  __memcpy_conventional(void *to, const void *from, size_t n)
00020 {
00021   int dummy1;
00022   long dummy2, dummy3;
00023     __asm__ __volatile__("cld\n\t"
00024             "cmpl $0,%%edx\n\t"
00025             "jle 2f\n\t"
00026             "movl %%edi,%%ecx\n\t"
00027             "andl $1,%%ecx\n\t"
00028             "subl %%ecx,%%edx\n\t"
00029             "rep ; movsb\n\t"   /* 16-bit align destination */
00030             "movl %%edx,%%ecx\n\t"
00031             "shrl $2,%%ecx\n\t"
00032             "jz 3f\n\t"
00033             "rep ; movsl\n\t"
00034             "3:\n\t"
00035             "testb $1,%%dl\n\t"
00036             "je 1f\n\t"
00037             "movsb\n"
00038             "1:\ttestb $2,%%dl\n\t"
00039             "je 2f\n\t"
00040             "movsw\n"
00041             "2:\n"
00042   :         "=d"(dummy1), "=D"(dummy2), "=S"(dummy3)   /* fake output */ 
00043   :         "0"(n), "1"((long) to), "2"((long) from)
00044   :         "cx"/***rjr***, "dx", "di", "si"***/
00045   );
00046     return (to);
00047 }
00048 
00049 
00050 static inline void *
00051  __memcpyb(void *to, const void *from, size_t n)
00052 {
00053   int dummy1;
00054   long dummy2, dummy3;
00055     __asm__ __volatile__("cld\n\t"
00056             "rep ; movsb\n\t"
00057   :         "=c"(dummy1), "=D"(dummy2), "=S"(dummy3) /* fake output */
00058   :         "0"(n), "1"((long) to), "2"((long) from)
00059                          /***rjr***:        "cx", "di", "si"***/
00060   );
00061     return (to);
00062 }
00063 
00064 static inline void *
00065  __memsetb(void *s, char c, size_t count)
00066 {
00067     __asm__("cld\n\t"
00068             "rep\n\t"
00069             "stosb"
00070   : :       "a"(c), "D"(s), "c"(count)
00071   :         "cx", "di");
00072     return s;
00073 }
00074 
00075 static inline void *
00076  __memsetlong(void *s, unsigned c, size_t count)
00077 {
00078   long dummy1;
00079   int dummy2;
00080     __asm__ __volatile__("cld\n\t"
00081             "rep\n\t"
00082             "stosl"
00083   :         "=D"(dummy1), "=c"(dummy2) /* fake outputs */
00084   :         "a"(c), "0"(s), "1"(count)
00085                          /***rjr***:        "cx", "di"***/
00086   );
00087     return s;
00088 }
00089 
00090 static inline void *
00091  __memset(void *s, char c, size_t count)
00092 {
00093   int dummy1;
00094   long dummy2;
00095   int dummy3;
00096     __asm__ __volatile__(
00097                "cld\n\t"
00098                "cmpl $12,%%edx\n\t"
00099                "jl 1f\n\t"      /* if (count >= 12) */
00100 
00101                "movzbl %%al,%%ax\n\t"
00102                "movl %%eax,%%ecx\n\t"
00103                "shll $8,%%ecx\n\t"      /* c |= c << 8 */
00104                "orl %%ecx,%%eax\n\t"
00105                "movl %%eax,%%ecx\n\t"
00106                "shll $16,%%ecx\n\t"     /* c |= c << 16 */
00107                "orl %%ecx,%%eax\n\t"
00108 
00109                "movl %%edx,%%ecx\n\t"
00110                "negl %%ecx\n\t"
00111                "andl $3,%%ecx\n\t"      /* (-s % 4) */
00112                "subl %%ecx,%%edx\n\t"   /* count -= (-s % 4) */
00113                "rep ; stosb\n\t"        /* align to longword boundary */
00114 
00115                "movl %%edx,%%ecx\n\t"
00116                "shrl $2,%%ecx\n\t"
00117                "rep ; stosl\n\t"        /* fill longwords */
00118 
00119                "andl $3,%%edx\n"        /* fill last few bytes */
00120                "1:\tmovl %%edx,%%ecx\n\t"       /* <= 12 entry point */
00121                "rep ; stosb\n\t"
00122   :            "=a"(dummy1), "=D"(dummy2), "=d"(dummy3) /* fake outputs */
00123   :            "0"(c), "1"(s), "2"(count)
00124   :            /***rjr***"ax",*/ "cx"/*, "dx", "di"*/
00125   );
00126     return s;
00127 }
00128 
00129 static inline void *
00130  __memset2(void *s, short c, size_t count)
00131 /* count is in 16-bit pixels */
00132 /* s is assumed to be 16-bit aligned */
00133 {
00134   int dummy1;
00135   long dummy2;
00136   int dummy3;
00137     __asm__ __volatile__(
00138                "cld\n\t"
00139                "cmpl $12,%%edx\n\t"
00140                "jl 1f\n\t"      /* if (count >= 12) */
00141 
00142                "movzwl %%ax,%%eax\n\t"
00143                "movl %%eax,%%ecx\n\t"
00144                "shll $16,%%ecx\n\t"     /* c |= c << 16 */
00145                "orl %%ecx,%%eax\n\t"
00146 
00147                "movl %%edi,%%ecx\n\t"
00148                "andl $2,%%ecx\n\t"      /* s & 2 */
00149                "jz 2f\n\t"
00150                "decl %%edx\n\t" /* count -= 1 */
00151                "movw %%ax,(%%edi)\n\t"  /* align to longword boundary */
00152                "addl $2,%%edi\n\t"
00153 
00154                "2:\n\t"
00155                "movl %%edx,%%ecx\n\t"
00156                "shrl $1,%%ecx\n\t"
00157                "rep ; stosl\n\t"        /* fill longwords */
00158 
00159                "andl $1,%%edx\n"        /* one 16-bit word left? */
00160                "jz 3f\n\t"      /* no, finished */
00161                "1:\tmovl %%edx,%%ecx\n\t"       /* <= 12 entry point */
00162                "rep ; stosw\n\t"
00163                "3:\n\t"
00164   :            "=a"(dummy1), "=D"(dummy2), "=d"(dummy3) /* fake outputs */
00165   :            "0"(c), "1"(s), "2"(count)
00166   :            /***rjr***"ax",*/ "cx"/*, "dx", "di"*/
00167   );
00168     return s;
00169 }
00170 
00171 static inline void *
00172  __memset3(void *s, int c, size_t count)
00173 /* count is in 24-bit pixels (3 bytes per pixel) */
00174 {
00175   int dummy1;
00176   long dummy2;
00177   int dummy3;
00178     __asm__ __volatile__(
00179                "cmpl $8,%%edx\n\t"
00180     /*      "jmp 2f\n\t" *//* debug */
00181                "jl 2f\n\t"
00182 
00183                "movl %%eax,%%esi\n\t"   /* esi = (low) BGR0 (high) */
00184                "shll $24,%%eax\n\t"     /* eax = 000B */
00185                "orl %%eax,%%esi\n\t"    /* esi = BGRB */
00186 
00187                "movl %%esi,%%eax\n\t"
00188                "shrl $8,%%eax\n\t"      /* eax = GRB0 */
00189                "movl %%eax,%%ecx\n\t"
00190                "shll $24,%%ecx\n\t"     /* ecx = 000G */
00191                "orl %%ecx,%%eax\n\t"    /* eax = GRBG */
00192 
00193                "movl %%esi,%%ecx\n\t"
00194                "shll $8,%%ecx\n\t"      /* ecx = 0BGR */
00195                "movb %%ah,%%cl\n\t"     /* ecx = RBGR */
00196 
00197                "cmpl $16,%%edx\n\t"
00198                "jl 1f\n\t"
00199                "jmp 5f\n\t"
00200                ".align 4,0x90\n\t"
00201 
00202                "5:\n\t"         /* loop unrolling */
00203                "movl %%esi,(%%edi)\n\t"         /* write BGRB */
00204                "movl %%eax,4(%%edi)\n\t"        /* write GRBG */
00205                "movl %%ecx,8(%%edi)\n\t"        /* write RBGR */
00206                "movl %%esi,12(%%edi)\n\t"
00207                "movl %%eax,16(%%edi)\n\t"
00208                "movl %%ecx,20(%%edi)\n\t"
00209                "movl %%esi,24(%%edi)\n\t"
00210                "movl %%eax,28(%%edi)\n\t"
00211                "movl %%ecx,32(%%edi)\n\t"
00212                "movl %%esi,36(%%edi)\n\t"
00213                "subl $16,%%edx\n\t"     /* blend end-of-loop instr. */
00214                "movl %%eax,40(%%edi)\n\t"
00215                "movl %%ecx,44(%%edi)\n\t"
00216                "addl $48,%%edi\n\t"
00217                "cmpl $16,%%edx\n\t"
00218                "jge 5b\n\t"
00219                "andl %%edx,%%edx\n\t"
00220                "jz 4f\n\t"      /* finished */
00221                "cmpl $4,%%edx\n\t"
00222                "jl 2f\n\t"      /* less than 4 pixels left */
00223                "jmp 1f\n\t"
00224                ".align 4,0x90\n\t"
00225 
00226                "1:\n\t"
00227                "movl %%esi,(%%edi)\n\t"         /* write BGRB */
00228                "movl %%eax,4(%%edi)\n\t"        /* write GRBG */
00229                "movl %%ecx,8(%%edi)\n\t"        /* write RBGR */
00230                "addl $12,%%edi\n\t"
00231                "subl $4,%%edx\n\t"
00232                "cmpl $4,%%edx\n\t"
00233                "jge 1b\n\t"
00234 
00235                "2:\n\t"
00236                "cmpl $0,%%edx\n\t"      /* none left? */
00237                "jle 4f\n\t"     /* finished */
00238 
00239                "mov %%ecx,%%eax\n\t"
00240                "shrl $8,%%ecx\n\t"      /* R in cl */
00241 
00242                "3:\n\t"         /* write last few pixels */
00243                "movw %%cx,(%%edi)\n\t"  /* write BG */
00244                "movb %%al,2(%%edi)\n\t"         /* write R */
00245                "addl $3,%%edi\n\t"
00246                "decl %%edx\n\t"
00247                "jnz 3b\n\t"
00248 
00249                "4:\n\t"
00250   :            "=a"(dummy1), "=D"(dummy2), "=d"(dummy3) /* fake outputs */
00251   :            "0"(c), "1"(s), "2"(count)
00252   :            /***rjr***"ax",*/ "cx", /*"dx",*/ "si"/*, "di"*/
00253   );
00254     return s;
00255 }

00259 extern void __svgalib_memcpy4to3(void *dest, void *src, int n);
00260 extern void __svgalib_memcpy32shift8(void *dest, void *src, int n);
00261 
00262 /* Functions for which arguments must be passed in %ebx, %edx, and %ecx. */
00263 #if 0                           /* Why declare 'em? Just confuses the compiler and can't be called from C
00264                                    anyway */
00265 extern __memcpyasm_regargs();   /* nu_bytes >= 3 */
00266 extern __memcpyasm_regargs_aligned();   /* nu_bytes >= 32 */
00267 #endif

00269 
00270 /* Always 32-bit align destination, even for a small number of bytes. */
00271 static inline void *
00272  __memcpy_aligndest(void *dest, const void *src, int n)
00273 {
00274     __asm__ __volatile__("cmpl $3, %%ecx\n\t"
00275                          "ja 1f\n\t"
00276                          "call * __memcpy_jumptable (, %%ecx, 4)\n\t"
00277                          "jmp 2f\n\t"
00278                          "1:call __memcpyasm_regargs\n\t"
00279                          "2:":
00280                          :"S"(dest), "d"(src), "c"(n)
00281                          :"ax", "0", "1", "2");
00282     return dest;
00283 }
00284 
00285 
00286 /* Optimized version for 32-bit aligned destination. */
00287 static inline void *
00288  __memcpy_destaligned(void *dest, const void *src, int n)
00289 {
00290     __asm__ __volatile__("cmpl $32, %%ecx\n\t"
00291                          "ja 1f\n\t"
00292                          "call * __memcpy_jumptable (, %%ecx, 4)\n\t"
00293                          "jmp 2f\n\t"
00294                          "1:call __memcpyasm_regargs_aligned\n\t"
00295                          "2:\n\t":
00296                          :"S"(dest), "d"(src), "c"(n)
00297                          :"ax", "0", "1", "2");
00298     return dest;
00299 }
00300 
00301 
00302 /* Balanced inline memcpy; 32-bit align destination if nu_bytes >= 20. */
00303 static inline void *
00304  __memcpy_balanced(void *dest, const void *src, int n)
00305 {
00306     __asm__ __volatile__("cmpl $19, %%ecx\n\t"
00307                          "ja 1f\n\t"
00308                          "call * __memcpy_jumptable (, %%ecx, 4)\n\t"
00309                          "jmp 2f\n\t"
00310                          "1:call __memcpyasm_regargs\n\t"
00311                          "2:\n\t"
00312                          :
00313                          :"S"((long) dest), "d"((long) src), "c"((long) n)
00314                          :"ax", "0", "1", "2");
00315     return dest;
00316 }
